skill.name: scvi-tools
skill.description: This skill should be used when working with single-cell omics data analysis using scvi-tools, including scRNA-seq, scATAC-seq, CITE-seq, spatial transcriptomics, and other single-cell modalities. Use this skill for probabilistic modeling, batch correction, dimensionality reduction, differential expression, cell type annotation, multimodal integration, and spatial analysis tasks.

content.user_title: Analyze single cell omics with scvi-tools
content.value_statement: Single cell datasets are noisy and hard to integrate across batches and modalities. This skill guides scvi-tools workflows for modeling, integration, and differential expression.
actual_capabilities: Explain scVI and scANVI workflows for batch correction and annotation
Guide setup_anndata, model training, and latent representation extraction
Detail differential_expression parameters and result interpretation
Describe ATAC-seq model usage for PeakVI and PoissonVI
Outline spatial workflows such as DestVI deconvolution and Tangram mapping
limitations: Does not execute scvi-tools or install packages
Requires AnnData inputs with raw counts for most models
Cannot validate biological conclusions from results
GPU usage depends on your local hardware and setup

use_cases.title: Batch corrected scRNA-seq
use_cases.description: Plan scVI setup, covariates, and downstream clustering for multi batch scRNA-seq.

use_cases.title: Multimodal integration
use_cases.description: Design MultiVI or totalVI workflows for paired and unpaired RNA and protein data.

use_cases.title: Spatial deconvolution
use_cases.description: Apply DestVI or Stereoscope steps to map cell types onto spatial spots.

prompt_templates.title: Start with scVI
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the steps to set up AnnData, train scVI, and extract a latent space for clustering. Include key parameters to review.

prompt_templates.title: Run differential expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to run differential_expression between two cell types and how to interpret lfc_mean and bayes_factor.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate RNA and ATAC
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a MultiVI plan for mixed paired and unpaired RNA and ATAC data, including modality keys and imputation outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Map cells to space
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe a DestVI workflow using a scRNA-seq reference to deconvolve Visium spots and visualize cell type proportions.

output_examples.input: I need a plan to integrate two scRNA-seq batches and run differential expression.
output: Use raw counts and register batch and covariates with setup_anndata
Train scVI and extract a batch corrected latent representation
Cluster on the latent space and label cell groups
Run differential_expression for the selected groups and review effect sizes

best_practices: Keep raw counts in a layer and register covariates before training
Validate batch correction with UMAP colored by batch and cell type
Save trained models for reuse and reproducibility
anti_patterns: Training on log normalized data instead of raw counts
Ignoring batch or donor covariates during setup
Interpreting small effect sizes as strong biology without thresholds

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: It targets scvi-tools workflows and integrates with scanpy and AnnData conventions.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It provides instructions and parameters but does not run models or produce results.

faq.question: Can it help with integration across modalities?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers totalVI and MultiVI integration patterns and required metadata.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides guidance and does not access files or send data.

faq.question: What if training fails with NaN loss?
faq.answer: Check raw counts, lower the learning rate, and validate input values are nonnegative.

faq.question: How does scvi-tools compare to Seurat integration?
faq.answer: scvi-tools uses probabilistic models and batch aware VAEs, which can improve uncertainty handling.
